subject: p19389547
History: -year-old man, status post tracheobronchoplasty,, patient has a history of severe allergic asthma, now with persistent cough and pain on inspiration on the right side at the level of T4-T5.
Findings: The cardiac, mediastinal, and hilar contours are unremarkable. Both lungs are clear with no focal consolidation, pleural effusion, or pneumothorax. Mild hyperinflated lungs are noted with flattening of the hemidiaphragms.
